publicationStmt.publisher: Wellcome Library; Bibliotheca Alexandrina; King's College London

msContents.summary: 1 copy of al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb by Avicenna, 980-1037

author.persName: ابو على الحسين ابن عبد الله ابن سينا

msItem.title: Al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb
كتاب القانون في الطبّ
msItem.note: The first, the second and the third books of Avicenna's Canon of Medicine.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 2b.1 بسم اللّه الرحمن الرحيم وبه نستعين ونتوكل عليه
Fol. 2b.2 والحمد للّه حمدًا يستحقه بعلو شانه وشبوع احسانه
Fol. 2b.3 وبعد وقد التمس منى بعض خلص اخواني ومن يلزمنى اسعافه فيما يسح به وسعى ان اضف فى الطب كتابًا مشتملًا على قوانينه الكلية والجزئية اشتمالًا
msItem.explicit: Fol. 528a.12 فصل فى انتفاخ الاظفار والحكة فيها تعالج بما البحر غلسا دايما فيزول به وبطبيخ العدس والكرسنه او بطبيخ الخنثى ومن اضمدته البنبوس والزفت والتين الاصفر المطبوخ مجموعة وفرادى
msItem.colophon: فهذا اخر الكلام من الكتاب الثالث وقد استوفينا الكلام منه حسب ما يليق بذلك وعلينا ان نشرع الان فى الكتاب الرابع حامدين لله تعالى

supportDesc.support: Oriental paper of two colours: 'beige' and 'biscuit' and thickness of 0.10 mm.
supportDesc.foliation: Arabic, original. Catchwords are written underneath the text block.

seg.formula: Due to the binding and the subsequent restoration, collation could not be established exactly.

supportDesc.condition: Good; traces of worms and occasionally water-stained.

handNote.p: Ink: Black; headings and dividers highlighted in red

binding.p: Original, Oriental type; slightly worn, blind tooling. On the spine is pasted a library tag with words: طبّ حطى عربى.

accMat.p:
The manuscript is written by two copyists. Fols 2 - 269 have been written initially; fols. 1 - 3, 32 - 33, 40 - 41, 144 - 153, 206 were replaced in course of restoration; fol. 3ab was written by the first scribe and pasted down on the paper used by the second scribe. Fols. 270 - 528 have been added later by the hand of the second scribe.
Fols. 4 - 52: on the folios written by the first scribe the foliotation and pagination are added on margins. Fol. 52 onwards: only foliotation used by the first scribe is added. In the bottom of each folio the second scribe has added his foliotation, indicating hundreds and tens. Thus number "479" appears: ٤٠٠٧٠٩, i.e. 400+70+9 (cf. fol. 480)
Fols 4a, 5a, 6b, 7a, 8a - 14b, 16b, 17a, 18ab, 21b, 22b, 29b, 35a, 44a, 46a, 49b, 50a, 58a, 60a, 68b, 69ab, 70a (large), 70b - 82b, 92b, 102b, 106a, 107b, 108b, 114a, 115a (a line crossed out), 121a, 138a, 177a, 183a, 195b, 196a, 199a, 200a - 201b, 205a, 208ab, 214a, 216a, 218a, 219a, 226a, 232a, 237a, 240b, 244a, 253b, 254b, 267a contain occasional indications on the contents, additions, corrections and "left-out" parts of words.
Fol. 128 is a mistake in the original foliotation. Fol. 172 has a mistake in foliotation used by the second scribe.
Fols 35 - 38, 49, 56 - 143, 154 - 184, 186 - 205, 207 - 269 are water-stained and have evidences of restoration.

listBibl.bibl: Ullmann Medizin p. 152, Iskandar Catalogue p. 162 (Shelf-mark: WMS Or. 1a)
